description: Aramaic [Term?], from Ancient Greek γεωμετρία (geōmetría, “geometry”). Doublet of geometry.

nouns.description: gematria (countable and uncountable, plural gematrias or gematriot)

entries.meaning: A cabalistic method of interpreting Hebrew words, based on numerical values of letters.
examples: each letter in this alphabet also has its own numerical value, what was known among ancient Jewish students of the Torah as ‘gematria’.
